Classes.Name: Cleric
Classes.Description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power. Clerics combine potent spellcasting with martial capability, serving as healers, protectors, and warriors of their faith.

Subclasses.Name: Life Domain
Subclasses.Description: The Life domain focuses on the vibrant positive energy that sustains all life, promoting vitality and health.

Features.Name: Bonus Proficiency
Features.Description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Features.Name: Disciple of Life
Features.Description: Your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

Features.Name: Preserve Life
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to heal the badly injured. As an action, you present your holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore hit points equal to five times your cleric level.

Features.Name: Blessed Healer
Features.Description: The healing spells you cast on others heal you as well. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than you, you regain hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

Subclasses.Name: Light Domain
Subclasses.Description: Gods of light promote the ideals of rebirth and renewal, truth, vigilance, and beauty, often using the power of the sun and fire.

Features.Name: Warding Flare
Features.Description: You can interpose divine light between yourself and an attacking enemy. When you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing light to flare before the attacker.

Features.Name: Light Cantrip
Features.Description: You learn the Light cantrip if you don't already know it.

Features.Name: Radiance of the Dawn
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to harness sunlight, banishing darkness and dealing radiant damage to your foes. As an action, you present your holy symbol, and any magical darkness within 30 feet of you is dispelled. Each hostile creature within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 + your cleric level radiant damage.

Features.Name: Improved Flare
Features.Description: You can also use your Warding Flare feature when a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you attacks a creature other than you.

Features.Name: Potent Spellcasting
Features.Description: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

Subclasses.Name: Trickery Domain
Subclasses.Description: Gods of trickery are mischief-makers and instigators who stand as a constant challenge to the accepted order.

Features.Name: Blessing of the Trickster
Features.Description: You can use your action to touch a willing creature other than yourself to give it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. This blessing lasts for 1 hour or until you use this feature again.

Features.Name: Invoke Duplicity
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to create an illusory duplicate of yourself. As an action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute. You can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space.

Features.Name: Cloak of Shadows
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to vanish. As an action, you become invisible until the end of your next turn. You become visible if you attack or cast a spell.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with poison. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage.

Subclasses.Name: War Domain
Subclasses.Description: War gods see armed conflict as a test of valor and courage, inspiring warriors to fight with divine favor.

Features.Name: Bonus Proficiencies
Features.Description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

Features.Name: War Priest
Features.Description: When you use the Attack action, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once).

Features.Name: Guided Strike
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to strike with supernatural accuracy. When you make an attack roll, you can use your Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

Features.Name: War God's Blessing
Features.Description: When a creature within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to grant that creature a +10 bonus to the roll, using your Channel Divinity.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon.

Subclasses.Name: Knowledge Domain
Subclasses.Description: The gods of knowledge value learning and understanding above all, blessing those who pursue enlightenment.

Features.Name: Blessings of Knowledge
Features.Description: You learn two languages of your choice. You also become proficient in your choice of two skills from Arcana, History, Nature, and Religion. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those skills.

Features.Name: Knowledge of the Ages
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to tap into a divine well of knowledge. As an action, you choose one skill or tool. For 10 minutes, you have proficiency with the chosen skill or tool.

Features.Name: Read Thoughts
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to read a creature's thoughts. Choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, you can't use this feature on it again. If it fails, you can read its surface thoughts.

Features.Name: Potent Spellcasting
Features.Description: You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

Subclasses.Name: Nature Domain
Subclasses.Description: Gods of nature are as varied as the natural world itself, representing the beauty and fury of the wilderness.

Features.Name: Acolyte of Nature
Features.Description: You learn one druid cantrip of your choice. You also gain proficiency in one skill from Animal Handling, Nature, or Survival.

Features.Name: Bonus Proficiency
Features.Description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

Features.Name: Charm Animals and Plants
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to charm animals and plants. As an action, you present your holy symbol and invoke the name of your deity. Each beast or plant creature within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute.

Features.Name: Dampen Elements
Features.Description: When you or a creature within 30 feet of you takes acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can use your reaction to grant resistance to that damage type.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice).

Subclasses.Name: Tempest Domain
Subclasses.Description: Gods of the tempest send their clerics to inspire fear in the common folk, either to keep those folk on the path of righteousness or to encourage them to offer sacrifices of propitiation.

Features.Name: Bonus Proficiencies
Features.Description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons and heavy armor.

Features.Name: Wrath of the Storm
Features.Description: When a creature within 5 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d8 lightning or thunder damage (your choice) on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

Features.Name: Destructive Wrath
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to wield the power of the storm with unchecked ferocity. When you roll lightning or thunder damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

Features.Name: Thunderbolt Strike
Features.Description: When you deal lightning damage to a Large or smaller creature, you can also push it up to 10 feet away from you.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with divine energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 thunder damage.

Subclasses.Name: Death Domain
Subclasses.Description: The Death domain is concerned with the forces that cause death, as well as the negative energy that gives rise to undead creatures.

Features.Name: Bonus Proficiency
Features.Description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons.

Features.Name: Reaper
Features.Description: You learn one necromancy cantrip of your choice from any spell list. When you cast a necromancy cantrip that normally targets only one creature, the spell can instead target two creatures within range and within 5 feet of each other.

Features.Name: Touch of Death
Features.Description: You can use Channel Divinity to destroy another creature's life force by touch. When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can use Channel Divinity to deal extra necrotic damage to the target equal to 5 + twice your cleric level.

Features.Name: Inescapable Destruction
Features.Description: Your ability to channel negative energy becomes more potent. Necrotic damage dealt by your cleric spells and Channel Divinity options ignores resistance to necrotic damage.

Features.Name: Divine Strike
Features.Description: You gain the ability to infuse your weapon strikes with necrotic energy. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage.

Features.Name: Spellcasting
Features.Description: As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. You prepare spells from the cleric spell list.

Features.Name: Divine Domain
Features.Description: Choose one domain related to your deity. Your choice grants you domain spells and other features.

Features.Name: Turn Undead
Features.Description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

Features.Name: Channel Divinity
Features.Description: You gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two effects: Turn Undead and an effect determined by your domain.

Features.Name: Level 2 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 2nd-level cleric spells.

Features.Name: Destroy Undead
Features.Description: When an undead fails its saving throw against your Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed if its challenge rating is at or below a certain threshold (CR 1/2 at 5th level).

Features.Name: Level 3 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 3rd-level cleric spells.

Features.Name: Level 4 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 4th-level cleric spells.

Features.Name: Level 5 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 5th-level cleric spells.

Features.Name: Divine Intervention
Features.Description: You can call on your deity to intervene on your behalf when your need is great. Describe the assistance you seek, and roll percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your cleric level, your deity intervenes.

Features.Name: Level 6 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 6th-level cleric spells.

Classes.Name: Paladin
Classes.Description: A holy warrior bound to a sacred oath. Paladins combine martial prowess with divine magic, smiting evil and protecting the innocent through strength and conviction.

Subclasses.Name: Oath of Devotion
Subclasses.Description: The Oath of Devotion binds a paladin to the loftiest ideals of justice, virtue, and order, acting with honor in pursuit of justice and the greater good.

Features.Name: Tenets of Devotion
Features.Description: You swear to uphold the tenets of honesty, courage, compassion, honor, and duty.

Features.Name: Sacred Weapon
Features.Description: As an action, you can imbue one weapon with positive energy using your Channel Divinity. For 1 minute, you add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls made with that weapon, and it emits bright light in a 20-foot radius.

Features.Name: Turn the Unholy
Features.Description: As an action using your Channel Divinity, you can cause fiends and undead within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute.

Features.Name: Aura of Devotion
Features.Description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be charmed while you are conscious.

Subclasses.Name: Oath of the Ancients
Subclasses.Description: The Oath of the Ancients is as old as the race of elves and the rituals of the druids, dedicated to preserving light, life, and beauty in the world.

Features.Name: Tenets of the Ancients
Features.Description: You swear to kindle the light, shelter the light, preserve your own light, and be the light.

Features.Name: Nature's Wrath
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to invoke primeval forces to ensnare a foe. As an action, spectral vines spring up and restrain a creature within 10 feet unless it succeeds on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw.

Features.Name: Turn the Faithless
Features.Description: You can use your Channel Divinity to utter ancient words that cause fey and fiends within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw or be turned for 1 minute.

Features.Name: Aura of Warding
Features.Description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet have resistance to damage from spells.

Subclasses.Name: Oath of Vengeance
Subclasses.Description: The Oath of Vengeance is a solemn commitment to punish those who have committed grievously evil acts.

Features.Name: Tenets of Vengeance
Features.Description: You swear to fight the greater evil, show no mercy to your foes, and pursue your enemies by any means necessary.

Features.Name: Abjure Enemy
Features.Description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and utter a denunciation using your Channel Divinity. Choose one creature within 60 feet that you can see. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute or until it takes damage. Its speed is also reduced to 0.

Features.Name: Vow of Enmity
Features.Description: As a bonus action, you can utter a vow of enmity using your Channel Divinity. Choose one creature within 10 feet. You gain advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls unconscious.

Features.Name: Relentless Avenger
Features.Description: When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, you can move up to half your speed immediately after the attack as part of the same reaction. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

Subclasses.Name: Oath of the Crown
Subclasses.Description: The Oath of the Crown is sworn to the ideals of civilization, representing devotion to law, loyalty to sovereign authority, and service to the people.

Features.Name: Tenets of the Crown
Features.Description: You swear to uphold law, loyalty, courage, and responsibility.

Features.Name: Champion's Challenge
Features.Description: You issue a challenge using your Channel Divinity that compels other creatures to do battle with you. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from you.

Features.Name: Turn the Tide
Features.Description: As a bonus action using your Channel Divinity, you can bolster injured creatures. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet regains hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier if it has no more than half of its hit points.

Features.Name: Divine Allegiance
Features.Description: When a creature within 5 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to magically substitute your own health for that of the target creature, causing you to take the damage instead.

Subclasses.Name: Oathbreaker
Subclasses.Description: An Oathbreaker is a paladin who breaks their sacred oaths to pursue some dark ambition or serve an evil power.

Features.Name: Fallen Paladin
Features.Description: You have forsaken your oath and now draw power from darker sources.

Features.Name: Control Undead
Features.Description: As an action using your Channel Divinity, you target one undead creature within 30 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it must obey your commands for 24 hours or until you use this feature again.

Features.Name: Dreadful Aspect
Features.Description: As an action using your Channel Divinity, you channel the darkest emotions. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet must make a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute.

Features.Name: Aura of Hate
Features.Description: You and any fiends or undead within 10 feet of you gain a bonus to melee weapon damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1).

Features.Name: Divine Sense
Features.Description: The presence of strong evil registers on your senses like a noxious odor, and powerful good rings like heavenly music in your ears. As an action, you can detect the location of any celestial, fiend, or undead within 60 feet that is not behind total cover.

Features.Name: Lay on Hands
Features.Description: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that can restore hit points equal to your paladin level  5. As an action, you can touch a creature and restore any number of hit points from this pool, or use 5 points to cure one disease or poison.

Features.Name: Sacred Oath
Features.Description: You swear the oath that binds you as a paladin forever. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 3rd, 7th, and later levels.

Features.Name: Fighting Style
Features.Description: You adopt a style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one option from Defense, Dueling, Great Weapon Fighting, or Protection.

Features.Name: Spellcasting
Features.Description: You have learned to draw on divine magic through meditation and prayer to cast spells as a cleric does. You prepare spells from the paladin spell list.

Features.Name: Divine Smite
Features.Description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st.

Features.Name: Divine Health
Features.Description: The divine magic flowing through you makes you immune to disease.

Features.Name: Extra Attack
Features.Description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Features.Name: Level 2 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 2nd-level paladin spells.

Features.Name: Aura of Protection
Features.Description: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). You must be conscious to grant this bonus.

Features.Name: Level 3 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 3rd-level paladin spells.

Features.Name: Aura of Courage
Features.Description: You and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be frightened while you are conscious.

Features.Name: Improved Divine Smite
Features.Description: You are so suffused with righteous might that all your melee weapon strikes carry divine power with them. Whenever you hit a creature with a melee weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d8 radiant damage.

Classes.Name: Druid
Classes.Description: A priest of the Old Faith, wielding the powers of nature and adopting animal forms. Druids revere nature above all, gaining their spells and other magical powers from the force of nature itself.

Subclasses.Name: Circle of the Land
Subclasses.Description: The Circle of the Land is made up of mystics and sages who safeguard ancient knowledge and rites through a vast oral tradition.

Features.Name: Natural Recovery
Features.Description: During a short rest, you can recover some of your magical energy. You can recover a combined spell slot level equal to half your druid level (rounded up).

Features.Name: Circle Spells
Features.Description: Your mystical connection to the land infuses you with the ability to cast certain spells based on your chosen terrain (Arctic, Coast, Desert, Forest, Grassland, Mountain, Swamp, or Underdark).

Features.Name: Land's Stride
Features.Description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed and without taking damage from thorns, spines, and similar hazards.

Features.Name: Nature's Ward
Features.Description: You can't be charmed or frightened by elementals or fey, and you are immune to poison and disease.

Subclasses.Name: Circle of the Moon
Subclasses.Description: Druids of the Circle of the Moon are fierce guardians of the wilds who take on the forms of beasts to battle threats.

Features.Name: Combat Wild Shape
Features.Description: You can use Wild Shape as a bonus action, and you can use a bonus action to expend one spell slot to regain 1d8 hit points per level of the spell slot while in Wild Shape.

Features.Name: Circle Forms
Features.Description: Your Wild Shape forms are stronger. You can transform into beasts with a challenge rating as high as 1 (ignoring the Max. CR column of the Beast Shapes table).

Features.Name: Primal Strike
Features.Description: Your attacks in beast form count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

Features.Name: Elemental Wild Shape
Features.Description: You can expend two uses of Wild Shape at the same time to transform into an air elemental, earth elemental, fire elemental, or water elemental.

Subclasses.Name: Circle of Spores
Subclasses.Description: Druids of the Circle of Spores find beauty in decay, seeing death as a part of the cycle of life.

Features.Name: Halo of Spores
Features.Description: You are surrounded by invisible necrotic spores. When a creature you can see moves into a space within 10 feet or starts its turn there, you can use your reaction to deal 1d4 necrotic damage to it (increasing as you level).

Features.Name: Symbiotic Entity
Features.Description: As an action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape to awaken the spores, gaining temporary hit points equal to 4 times your druid level. While active, your Halo of Spores damage increases, and your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 poison damage.

Features.Name: Fungal Infestation
Features.Description: When a beast or humanoid that is Small or Medium dies within 10 feet of you, you can use your reaction to animate it. It rises as a zombie that follows your mental commands.

Features.Name: Spreading Spores
Features.Description: As a bonus action while your Symbiotic Entity feature is active, you can hurl spores up to 30 feet away, where they swirl around. The area becomes difficult terrain, and creatures in it take damage from your Halo of Spores.

Subclasses.Name: Circle of Stars
Subclasses.Description: The Circle of Stars allows druids to draw on the power of starlight, reading portents in the heavens and manifesting stellar forms.

Features.Name: Star Map
Features.Description: You've created a star map, a Tiny object that you can use as a spellcasting focus. You know the guidance cantrip. You can cast guiding bolt without expending a spell slot a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

Features.Name: Starry Form
Features.Description: As a bonus action, you can expend a use of Wild Shape to take on a starry form (Archer, Chalice, or Dragon) for 10 minutes.

Features.Name: Cosmic Omen
Features.Description: When you finish a long rest, you can consult your Star Map to receive an omen. You can use this omen a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus to add or subtract 1d6 from an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.

Features.Name: Twinkling Constellations
Features.Description: The constellations of your Starry Form improve. Additionally, at the start of each of your turns while in your Starry Form, you can change which constellation glimmers on your body.

Features.Name: Spellcasting
Features.Description: Drawing on the divine essence of nature itself, you can cast spells to shape that essence to your will. You prepare spells from the druid spell list.

Features.Name: Druidic
Features.Description: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak it and use it to leave hidden messages.

Features.Name: Wild Shape
Features.Description: You can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice and regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

Features.Name: Druid Circle
Features.Description: You choose to identify with a circle of druids.

Features.Name: Level 2 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 2nd-level druid spells.

Features.Name: Wild Shape Improvement
Features.Description: Your Wild Shape improves. You can transform into beasts with a swimming speed and a CR of 1/2 or lower.

Features.Name: Wild Strike
Features.Description: You can attack twice when you take the Attack action while in Wild Shape.

Features.Name: Level 3 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 3rd-level druid spells.

Features.Name: Level 4 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 4th-level druid spells.

Features.Name: Wild Shape Improvement
Features.Description: You can transform into beasts with a flying speed and a CR of 1 or lower.

Features.Name: Level 5 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 5th-level druid spells.

Features.Name: Improved Wild Strike
Features.Description: You can attack three times when you take the Attack action while in Wild Shape.

Features.Name: Level 6 Spells
Features.Description: You can prepare 6th-level druid spells.

Features.Name: Wild Shape Improvement
Features.Description: Your Wild Shape maximum CR increases.

Classes.Name: Ranger
Classes.Description: A warrior who uses martial prowess and nature magic to combat threats on the edges of civilization. Rangers are hunters and trackers who protect the borderlands from encroaching monsters.

Subclasses.Name: Hunter
Subclasses.Description: Hunters are masters of woodcraft and combat tactics, specializing in fighting monsters that threaten civilization.

Features.Name: Hunter's Prey
Features.Description: Choose one feature: Colossus Slayer (extra 1d8 damage to wounded enemies once per turn), Giant Killer (reaction attack when Large+ creature misses you), or Horde Breaker (extra attack against different target within 5 feet).

Features.Name: Defensive Tactics
Features.Description: Choose one feature: Escape the Horde (opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage), Multiattack Defense (+4 AC against subsequent attacks from same creature), or Steel Will (advantage on saves against being frightened).

Features.Name: Multiattack
Features.Description: Choose one feature: Volley (attack all creatures in 10-foot radius), or Whirlwind Attack (melee attack all creatures within 5 feet).

Subclasses.Name: Beast Master
Subclasses.Description: Rangers of the Beast Master archetype form a deep bond with an animal companion, fighting together as one.

Features.Name: Ranger's Companion
Features.Description: You gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you. The beast obeys your commands and takes its turn on your initiative.

Features.Name: Primal Companion
Features.Description: You can summon a primal beast (Beast of the Land, Sea, or Sky) as a manifestation of your bond with nature.

Features.Name: Exceptional Training
Features.Description: On any of your turns when your beast companion doesn't attack, you can use a bonus action to command the beast to take the Dash, Disengage, or Help action on its turn.

Features.Name: Bestial Fury
Features.Description: When you command your beast companion to take the Attack action, the beast can make two attacks.

Subclasses.Name: Gloom Stalker
Subclasses.Description: Gloom Stalkers are at home in the darkest places, ambushing enemies from the shadows with devastating strikes.

Features.Name: Dread Ambusher
Features.Description: You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier. At the start of your first turn of each combat, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of that turn. If you take the Attack action on that turn, you can make one additional weapon attack as part of that action.

Features.Name: Umbral Sight
Features.Description: You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet. You are also adept at evading creatures that rely on darkvision: while in darkness, you are invisible to any creature that relies on darkvision to see you.

Features.Name: Iron Mind
Features.Description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws. If you already have this proficiency, you instead gain proficiency in Intelligence or Charisma saving throws (your choice).

Features.Name: Stalker's Flurry
Features.Description: Once on each of your turns when you miss with a weapon attack, you can make another weapon attack as part of the same action.

Subclasses.Name: Swarmkeeper
Subclasses.Description: Swarmkeepers are accompanied by a magical swarm of nature spirits that they can command in battle.

Features.Name: Gathered Swarm
Features.Description: A swarm of nature spirits accompanies you. Once on each of your turns when you hit with a weapon attack, you can deal an extra 1d6 piercing damage and choose one effect: move the target 15 feet, move yourself 5 feet, or gain advantage on the next attack against the target.

Features.Name: Writhing Tide
Features.Description: As a bonus action, you gain a flying speed of 10 feet and can hover. This lasts for 1 minute. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

Features.Name: Mighty Swarm
Features.Description: Your Gathered Swarm damage increases to 1d8. When you use Gathered Swarm, you can choose from additional effects or combine two effects.

Features.Name: Favoured Enemy
Features.Description: You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. Choose one favoured enemy type (Humanoids, Beasts, Undead, or Aberrations) and gain +2 damage bonus against them.

Features.Name: Natural Explorer
Features.Description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment. You have advantage on initiative rolls and cannot be surprised.

Features.Name: Fighting Style
Features.Description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one option from Archery (+2 to ranged attacks), Defense (+1 AC), Dueling (+2 melee damage with one weapon), or Two-Weapon Fighting (add ability modifier to offhand damage).

Features.Name: Spellcasting
Features.Description: You have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells. You gain access to ranger spells including Hunter's Mark, Ensnaring Strike, and Hail of Thorns.

Features.Name: Ranger Archetype
Features.Description: You choose an archetype that you strive to emulate.

Features.Name: Primeval Awareness
Features.Description: You can use your action and expend one ranger spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot, you can sense whether certain types of creatures are present within 1 mile of you.

Features.Name: Extra Attack
Features.Description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Features.Name: Level 2 Spells
Features.Description: You learn 2nd-level ranger spells.

Features.Name: Favoured Enemy Improvement
Features.Description: You can choose an additional favoured enemy and associated language.

Features.Name: Natural Explorer Improvement
Features.Description: You choose an additional favoured terrain.

Features.Name: Land's Stride
Features.Description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them.

Features.Name: Level 3 Spells
Features.Description: You learn 3rd-level ranger spells.

Features.Name: Hide in Plain Sight
Features.Description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. Once camouflaged, you can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface that is at least as tall and wide as you are. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions.

Features.Name: Natural Explorer Expansion
Features.Description: You are a master of navigating the natural world, and you react with swift and decisive action when attacked.
